intro: Seychellaria perrieri, commonly known as the Seychelles starling tree, is a unique plant native to the Seychelles archipelago. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in coastal and limestone habitats, often growing in dense shrublands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Seychellaria perrieri is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
